Articles.Content:
Issue: "Load" does not do anything.

I load up KSP(32bit) and proceed to the SPH and press "load", but the window that should normally pop up does not. everything else is working fine, I can click on all the other buttons and even load a craft through clicking the runway, but when I try to use a craft I last used pre-0.90 I get a message asking that I load my vehicle in SPH so the engineers can "analyze the size" of the craft, but again, not possible due to my problem.

I've tried verifying the cache through Steam, deleting the game files, re installing the game, starting new saves, and verifying again. The only mod I have installed is DarkMultiplayer.

Any suggestions? Thanks!

If it's just one save that exhibits the issue, it's most likely a corrupt .craft file. If you can identify a corrupted craft file (typically, the filesize will be quite low compared to others, and when opened in a text editor, you should see that it cuts off abruptly), you can delete it and everything should work again.

If it's more than one, and it affects new saves, though... it might be that the permissions on KSP's home directory aren't set correctly. You'll need to navigate to the Steamapps\common folder (in a default install, it's located at C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\Steamapps\common) and check the permissions on the Kerbal Space Program folder. There's a weird glitch happening here and there where Steam will set the KSP folder as Read-Only; if that's the case, make sure to remove that, and make sure it applies it for subfolders and files as well.

That's odd, but it seems to be the case here. I have unchecked the Read-only option, started up the .exe, go into my save game and try loading, but nothing happens again... I looked back at the folder properties and it has Read-only checked again, I don't know how to keep this a permanent option.

Sounds like the Data Execution Prevention Kraken, basically, don't run KSP from a protected Windows folder ever, you'll have to copy it to a non-Windows folder (like C:\Games) and run the copy.

Also, you're running a mod, moving this to modded installs.

I am having a similar problem. I am playing on 64bit, and installed KSP post-.90 with no mods. On career mode, I am unable to load saved ships in the VAB. The load button simply does nothing. The load button works in the SPH, but I still can't view saved rockets. I know they are saved because the ship save files are in the appropriate folder. When I inspected the KSP folder for the read-only issue, it was checked. When I unchecked it and reloaded the game, it immediately rechecked read-only.
the mod is exclusive to it's own save, and I am not running that save so for all intents and purposes this is stock.
